title: The useful formula here is: $${cos}^{2\left(\theta\right)}=\frac{1+cos\left(2\theta\right)}{2}$$ and $${sin}^{\theta}=\frac{1-cos\left(2\theta\right)}{2}$$
Using the sin formula above, rewrite $${sin}^{4\left(8x\right)}$$ as $$\left(\frac{1-cos\left(2\times8 x\right)}{2}\right)^2$$
After expanding the numerator, use the cosine formula on $${cos}^{2\left(16x\right)}$$. From here, simplify.
